wiki.content: The You Need Me Songfacts explains that Sheeran wrote this song after being told by his original managers that he needed to conform if he wanted to succeed by dying his ginger hair and ditching his unique loop-pedal rapped delivery, Twenty year old Ed was apparently told he should change his look to make it in the music business, but Ed responded by writing 'You Need Me, I Don't Need You'. It raced to No.4 in the UK chart in September 2011 as the follow-up to his massive debut hit 'The A Team'. User-contributed text is available under the Creative Commons By-SA License and may also be available under the GNU FDL.
wiki.summary: The You Need Me Songfacts explains that Sheeran wrote this song after being told by his original managers that he needed to conform if he wanted to succeed by dying his ginger hair and ditching his unique loop-pedal rapped delivery, Twenty year old Ed was apparently told he should change his look to make it in the music business, but Ed responded by writing 'You Need Me, I Don't Need You'. It raced to No.
